definition: Anatomical divisions of the brain with distinct functions and locations within the cranium.

positive_examples: The MRI scan showed damage to the frontal lobe affecting decision-making abilities.
Researchers found increased activity in the temporal lobes during memory recall tasks.
The stroke patient had lesions in the parietal lobe causing spatial awareness problems.
Neurosurgeons carefully mapped the occipital lobe before removing the tumor.
The hypothalamus regulates body temperature and hormone production.
Brain imaging revealed abnormal connections between the medulla and pons.
negative_examples: The spinal cord carries signals between the brain and peripheral nerves.
Cranial nerves control facial muscles and sensory functions.
The skull protects the brain from external trauma and injury.
Cerebrospinal fluid cushions the brain within the cranial cavity.
Blood vessels supply oxygen and nutrients to brain tissue.
The meninges are protective membranes surrounding the brain.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Muscles, Bones, Organs, Limbs, Joints
